summary: This is a suicide watch observation log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for an inmate, likely Jeffrey Epstein, beginning on July 23, 2019. It contains detailed 15-minute interval observations of the inmate's behavior, including references to him talking to himself and remembering 'what happened'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate under suicide watch observation, referenced by initials 'EP' and register number. The log details his activities and mental state in his cell.

events.title: Suicide watch initiation for inmate
events.description: A suicide watch was initiated for an inmate (Jeffrey Epstein) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Detailed 15-minute observations of his behavior were logged.

keyFacts: A suicide watch was initiated for an inmate (Jeffrey Epstein) on July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
The observation log records the inmate's behavior in 15-minute intervals, noting activities like lying on the bed, standing at the door, and talking to himself.
One specific observation at 2:30 AM notes the inmate was 'sitting on bed talking to himself remember what happened'.
The document is a standard Bureau of Prisons suicide watch form, indicating formal procedures were being followed for this inmate.
The inmate's register number is partially visible as '76318-054', which matches known Bureau of Prisons records for Jeffrey Epstein.
